turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: GET OUT OF THERE, YOU'RE UNSAFE. GET OUT OF THERE.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: FIRE, OR CLEAR OUT, ICE.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: GET LOST!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: YOU GOT TOO MUCH NOSE TO TAIL -- I'M COMING IN.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: IT'S MY SHOT.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: COME OFF--COME OFF RIGHT. I'M ON MY WAY IN. YOU GO FREE, I'M ENGAGING.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: STAY OUT OF IT. STAY OUT OF IT, MAVERICK.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: YOU CAN'T SHOOT HIM, I CAN. I'M IN.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: ICE, ROLL OFF, I CAN SHOOT HIM.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: NO, NO, NO, HE'S MINE.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: IF YOU CAN'T SHOOT HIM, I CAN.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: NO, I GOT HIM. I CAN TAKE HIM.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: OKAY, GOING UP. ICE, GO HIGH.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: LOOK OUT!

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: ON THE NOSE?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: GOT 'EM. GOT GOOD TONE.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I GOT A WINDER LEFT, BUT NO GOOD TONE ON IT.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: I CAN'T LOSE HIM, CAN YOU GET OFF A SHOT?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I GOT NO TONE. IT MIGHT GET YOU.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: WHAT CHOICE DO I HAVE?   SHOOT IT.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: WHEN I SHOOT, YOU BREAK LEFT..3..2

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: I guess I owe you one.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You don't owe me anything. We're on the same team.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: You saved our lives. You did it!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: We did it.

turns.speaker: ICE
turns.text: You're a hell of a flyer.  You can be my wingman any time.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: No. You can be mine!

turns.speaker: ICEMAN
turns.text: Figured it out yet?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Figured out what?

turns.speaker: ICEMAN
turns.text: Who is the best.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: ICEMAN
turns.text: Need a hint?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I think I can work it out on my own.

turns.speaker: ICEMAN
turns.text: You like to work alone. I've heard that about you.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I've heard of you, too. You were in 124 with Bargamian.

turns.speaker: ICEMAN
turns.text: And you were with Cougar. He was my roommate in flight school.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: The hard deck for this hop was ten thousand feet. Jester, at what point did you call off the fight?

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: Just below ten thousand.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: But you continued to fight.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: I don't know what to tell you, Skip.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Tell me one thing.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: He's seat of the pants... Completely unpredictable -- nothing by the book. All over the sky. But I don't know, Skip, he's really got something.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Yeah, we get one of these guys every damn class.   "Maverick!"

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: WALKED RIGHT INTO IT.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: NOT ONLY THAT, BUT ZORRO GOT YOUR WINGMAN. NICE GOING.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: He just won't engage. He can't do it, Skipper. He can't get back on the horse.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: It's only been a week. Keep sending him up.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: I've seen this before.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: So have I.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: Some guys never get it back.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: Who's the hell is that?

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Three guesses.

turns.speaker: JESTER
turns.text: Well, he's in trouble and he didn't even get here yet.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Ah, the thrill of victory and the agony of defeat.

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Speaking of feet, fuel's down to 4.0.  We're gonna get them wet unless we find a Sonoco station.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: COUGAR, THIS IS MAVERICK.  I'M GETTING HUNGRY, LET'S HEAD FOR THE BARN. ...COUGAR, WHERE ARE YOU?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I...FORGOT SOMETHING.

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: What the hell you doing?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Helping him in.

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: What makes you think we can get back in?  We don't have the fuel for this. MAVERICK Just get me to him.

turns.speaker: WOLFMAN
turns.text: You won?!!!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Didn't everybody?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It was bad.

turns.speaker: WOLFMAN
turns.text: Bad?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: The girl with the purple fingernails was Coogan's sister.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You didn't help.

turns.speaker: WOLFMAN
turns.text: No, really. She came ruined!... Ya think he knows it was me?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Morning, Coogan.

turns.speaker: WOLFMAN
turns.text: How's it goin', Coog?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: He's a good pilot.

turns.speaker: STINGER
turns.text: I talked a man back once. Three months later, we lost him. It's his decision. Only he knows.

turns.speaker: STINGER
turns.text: Was going.  Now you are.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: STINGER
turns.text: You just did an incredibly brave thing! What you should have done was land your plane. You don't own that plane, the taxpayers do. I should ream you out for it. But it just doesn't work with you. You're a hell of a flyer. You are maybe ...too good. You never really stepped in it yet. So this is your chance. I'm gonna send you up against the best. They are better than you. Maybe they'll knock that shine off your eagle and you'll see, finally, where discipline and teamwork fit it. Maverick hasn't really heard anything but TOPGUN. He snaps out of it.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: STINGER
turns.text: That is all. Tell me about the MiG some other time...

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Yes sir!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Yes sir..

turns.speaker: STINGER
turns.text: The wings..

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Considering the company you're in, that's a pretty arrogant attitude.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: I like that in a fighter pilot.  It's okay to be confident. You have to think you're King Kong to want to try to land on carriers. Just keep in mind the other component of success...teamwork.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Maverick... Where'd you get that call sign?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Ahhh... Runs in the family, sir.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: You're father was Marvin Mitchell..

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: A good man. Good flyer.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I had him in view. I was peeling over the egg, into a dive. He saw me when I moved in for the kill. There wasn't any danger...

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Is that how you remember it?

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: We weren't below for more than ten seconds. There was no danger. I had the shot. I took it.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: The rules of engagement are not flexible. They exist for your safety. You will obey them. Is that clear?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I wasn't thinking. I just did it.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Big gamble with a thirty million dollar plane!

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: SNAPSHOT..MISSED HIM..

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: ENGAGING THE OTHER GUY. WOOD, YOU'RE ON YOUR OWN.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Twenty years' experience, I couldn't shake you. You may be a great flyer. I mean that.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I lost.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Of course you did. I said a great flyer, not a smart one. You fly reckless. Great instincts. No discipline. That ambush today, you followed your emotions instead of your wingman. Of course you got killed...and well deserved to. It was a really stupid mistake. In battle, it gets people killed.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I can take care of myself.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Talent is no holy shield. Von Richtofen was killed by a farm boy. Instincts are not enough. Do it our way. We've worked these things out. The good pilots can become better and the great ones can learn how to stay alive.    Why do you have to do everything the hard way?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It's my own way. It works for me. I don't care about the rest of that stuff.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Then why are you here?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: For the same reason you are.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Oh, you mean the thrill!

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: The flying. The fighting.  I'd go up there ten times a day to fight. I'd win at least nine of them. That's all I want to do. It's what I do best. I am real good.  Just give me the jet.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: How do you feel?

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Goose is dead.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I know. I was there.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: He was...my responsibility--my RIO.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: My first squadron in Vietnam, we lost eight out of eighteen planes. Ten guys. The first one kills you, but there'll be others--you can count on it.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Skipper, sorry to bother you.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: No bother.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I called your house.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: My wife's house.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: She said you took your kid to the each. Every second Sunday. Zoo or beach or the ballgame. Y'have the option... What about me?

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: We can send you back to your squadron with nothing noted on your record except "CNC" --course not completed, no explanation required. Theoretically, it doesn't hurt your career, but people always wonder about things like that.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Or you can quit.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: I didn't know either. That's why I told Jester to prepare your papers.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: It's no disgrace, kid. That spin was hell. It would wreck anyone's confidence. You could be a good pilot again someday...

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You think I should quit?!

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: I didn't say that. That's up to you. But I have responsibility for the other guys up there, not just you. They need to know you're all right...that they can depend on you.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Sometimes it's luck, but in this case, he earned it... I served with your old man.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: VF 51, the Oriskany. You remind me of him. You're just like he was, only better...and worse.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I'm nothing like him.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: You may not think so, but you are.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: He was by the book, all the way.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: They waved him off. He thought he knew better. He hit the ramp.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: I never heard that.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Not something they tell dependents.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: It's not true.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: How can I go on? I feel so... responsible.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: Kid, the plain fact is...you are. I'm not gonna stand here and blow sunshine up your ass. Technically, they absolved you. You and I know what really happened. You pushed it. You are responsible and you'll always carry that. You know what, I'll carry it too. I should have taken you out of that cockpit. I guess I'm a hopeless romantic... I always try to find something worthwhile in someone's death. It's no trade-off. It's not one for one. What you learned isn't worth his death. It couldn't be. But maybe there is some value in it. I know it's the first thing I've ever seen that's really gotten to you. Now the question is, what will you do with it. If it gets you out of flight status...so you don't kill yourself or anybody else...that's good. That's one good thing. You were an accident waiting to happen.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: You think I shouldn't fly.

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: I didn't say that. That's up to you. I think that if you do, if you choose to come back, you'll be a better pilot... a better man.

turns.speaker: MAVERICK
turns.text: Would you take me back? Would they?

turns.speaker: VIPER
turns.text: I'll have to think about it. I don't know about them. I do know one thing, We've got a lot invested in you. We'd hate to lose it. Even more than those other guys, Naval Aviation needs a very few, very good men.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What's wrong with this one?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: He ain't got five kids to feed.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Where's yours?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Over there man.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: You got the job.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Welcome to Mars.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What was that?  An accident?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What to the rebels want?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Oh, the usual.  More money, more freedom, more air.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: So, where to?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: The Last Resort.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: You're getting off to an early start.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: First time on Mars?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Yeah...Well, actually no...Sort of.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Man don't know if he's been to Mars or not

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Tell me something; are all psychics, uh....?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Freaks?...'Fraid so, man.  Goes with the territory.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What happened to them?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Cheap domes.  And no air to screen out the rays.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Well, there it is; the Last Resort.  Sure you wanna go in?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I know a much better place down the block -- the girls are clean; the liquor ain't watered down...

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: And you get a kickback.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Lemme ask you a question.  Ever fuck a mutant?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Take me to the hotel.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What happened to number five?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Ah, shit.  You got me.  I ain't even married.  Now put your fucking hands in the air!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Need a ride?

turns.speaker: MELINA
turns.text: The Last Resort!  Quick!

turns.speaker: MELINA
turns.text: Shut up and drive!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Whatcha doin' to me, man?!  I got six kids to feed!

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: And if you wanna breathe, you gotta but his air.

turns.speaker: MELINA
turns.text: But maybe you can change all that.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I think my grampa might be here.

turns.speaker: MELINA
turns.text: How could you do this?  You're a mutant.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Hey, I got four kids to feed.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: CALLER
turns.text: They've got you bugged, and they'll be busting down the door in about three minutes unless you do exactly what I say.

turns.speaker: CALLER
turns.text: Don't bother looking.  It's in your skull.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: CALLER
turns.text: Never mind.  Wet a towel and wrap it around your head.  That'll muffle the signal.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: How'd you find me?

turns.speaker: CALLER
turns.text: I'd advise you to hurry.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Nice to have you back with us, Mr. Brubaker.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Would you like the same suite?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Definitely.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Hmm.  It seems you left something in our safe.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Get it, please.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Identification?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I'll go encode your room key.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: There you go, Mr. Brubaker.  Suite 610 in the East Wing.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: May I use your pen?

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Well, my boy, you're a hero.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Don't be modest.  Kuato's dead; the Resistance has been completely wiped out; and you were the key to the whole thing.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: You see, Quaid, none of my people could get close to Kuato.  The fucking mutants could always sniff us out.  So Hauser and I sat down and invented you: the perfect mole.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: He's lying.  Hauser turned against you.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: That's what we wanted you to think. The fact is, Hauser volunteered to become Doug Quaid. It was the only way to fool the psychics.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Get your story straight.  This idiot's been trying to kill me since I went to Rekall.  --You don't kill somebody you're trying to plant.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: He wasn't in on it.  You set him off by going to Rekall.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: So why am I still alive?

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: We gave you lots of help.  Benny here...

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: The guy with the suitcase; the mask; the money; the message form Hauser...All of that was set up by us.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Sorry.  Too perfect.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Perfect, my ass!  --You pop your memory cap before we can activate you.  Then Richter goes hod wild, screwing up everything I spent a year planning. --Frankly, I'm amazed is worked.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Well, Cohaagen, I have to hand it to you...This is the best mindfuck yet.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Don't take my word for it, Quaid. Someone you trust wants to talk to you.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Who is it this time--my mother?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: The guy's a fucking asshole.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Not true, he's one of my best friends...He's got a big house and a Mercedes.  And you like Melina, right?  Well, you'll get to fuck her every night.--That's right.  She's gonna be Hauser's babe.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Come on, Cohaagen!  You got what you want.  Give these people air!

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: My friend, five minutes from now, you won't give a shit about the people.  Fire it up, Doc.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What are you afraid of?  Turn it on.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Impossible.  Once the reaction starts, it'll spread to all the turbinium in the planet.  Mars will go into global meltdown.--That's why the aliens never turned it on.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Do you expect me to believe you?

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Who gives a shit what you believe? In thirty seconds, you'll be dead. Then I'll blow this place up...

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: I didn't want it to end this way.  I wanted Hauser back.  But nooo.  You had to be Quaid.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: I am Quaid.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: You're nothing!  You're nobody!  You're a stupid dream.  Well all dreams come to an end.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: What the fuck is going on down there?!

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: I'm trying to neutralize a traitor.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: If I wanted him dead, you moron, I wouldn't have dumped him on Earth.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: We can't let him run around.  He knows too much.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Lori says he can't remember jack shit!

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: That's now.  In an hour, he could have total recall.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Listen to me, Richter, I want Quaid delivered alive for re-implantation. Have you got that?  I want him back in place with Lori.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Richter, do you know why I'm such a happy person?

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Because I've got the greatest job in the solar system.  As long as the turbinium keeps flowing, I can do anything I want.  Anything.  If fact, the only thing I ever worry about is that one day, if the rebels win, it all might end.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: He had help.  From our side, sir.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: I know that.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: But I thought...

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Who told you to think?!  I don't give you enough information to think!  You do what you're told!!  That's what you do!

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Now let's get down to business.  Kuato wants what's in Quaid's head.  And he might be able to get it, cause they say he's psychic.  Now I have a little plan to keep this from happening.  --Do you think you can play along?

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Great!  Because, otherwise I'll erase your ass.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Stop fighting and get out.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: They've got Quaid!  They're protecting him!

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Perfect!...Get out of Sector G.  Now. Don't think.  Do it.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: I say we throw the switch and see what happens.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Don't be an idiot.

turns.speaker: COHAAGEN
turns.text: Kill him.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: It's about goddamn time.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Bob?

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: You better get down here.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: I'm with an very important client.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Looks like another schizoid embolism.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: What the fuck is going on here?!  You can't install a simple goddamn double implant?!

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: It's not my fault.  We hit a memory cap.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Listen to me!  He's been going on and on about Mars.  He's really been there.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Use your head, you dumb bitch!  He's acting out the secret agent role from his Ego Trip!

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: I'm afraid that's not possible.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: We haven't implanted it yet.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Oh shit....Oh shit...

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: I've been trying to tell you.  Someone erased his memory.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Okay, this is what we're gonna do. Renata, cover up any memory he has of us or Rekall.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: I'll do what I can.  It's getting messy in there.

turns.speaker: MCCLANE
turns.text: Ernie, dump him in a cab.  Around the corner.  Tiffany, you help him.  I'll destroy his file and refund his money.  And if anybody comes asking...we've never heard of Douglas Quaid.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Come on...put his head in place.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Good evening...  Doug.  I'm Dr. Lull.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Nice to meet you.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Two-headed monsters?

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Don't you keep up with the news?  We're doing alien artifacts now.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: So, been married long?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Eight years.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: I see.  Slipping away for a little hanky-panky.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Not really.  I've just always been fascinated by Mars.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Your sexual orientation?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Hetero.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Hmmm.  And how do you like your women?

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Blonde, brunette, redhead?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Brunette.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Slim, athletic, voluptuous?

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Demure, aggressive, sleazy?  Be honest.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Sleazy...and demure.

turns.speaker: DR. LULL
turns.text: Forty-one A, Ernie.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: This is going to be very difficult for you at accept, Mr. Quaid.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: I'm listening.

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: I'm afraid you're not really standing here right now.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Ya know, Doc, you could have folled me.

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: I'm quite serious.  You're not here, and neither am I.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Amazing.  Where are we?

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: At Rekall.

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: You're strapped into an implant chair, and I'm monitoring you at a psycho-probe console.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Oh, I get it; I'm dreaming!  And this is all part of that delightful vacation your company sold me.

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: Not exactly.  What you're experiencing is a free-form delusion based on our memory tapes.  But you're inventing it yourself as you go along.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Well, if this is my delusion, who invited you?

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: I've been artificially implanted as an emergency measure.  I'm sorry to tell you this, Mr. Quaid, but you've suffered a schizoid embolism. We can't snap you out of your fantasy. I've been sent in to try to talk you down.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: How much is Cohaagen paying you for this?

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: Think about it.  Your dream started in the middle of the implant procedure. Everything after that--the chases, the trip to Mars, your suite here at the Hilton--these are all elements of your Rekall Holiday.  And Ego Trip: You paid to be a secret agent.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Bullshit.  It's all coincidence.

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: What about the girl?  Brunette, athletic, sleazy and demure; just like you specified.  Is that a coincidence?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: She's real.  I dreamed about her before I even went to Rekall.

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: Mr. Quaid, can you hear yourself? "She's real because you dreamed her?"

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: You open it.

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: No need to be rude.  I'll do it.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Suppose I do...then what?

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: Swallow this.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: EDGEMAR
turns.text: It's a symbol.  Of your desire to return to reality. --Inside your dream, you'll fall asleep.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Mr. Cohaagen wants to see you right away.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: Any news of Quaid?

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Not since you lost him.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: Watch your mouth, Captain.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: Quaid!  That's Quaid!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: There!  The woman!

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: HER!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Arrest that woman!

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: Richter!  Call from Cohaagen.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: This is Richter sir...I've got them pinned down.

turns.speaker: RICHTER
turns.text: Pull them out.

turns.speaker: EVERETT
turns.text: O.K., everybody pull out!

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Hey, hey Tony.  Give the big guy a break.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Relax, you'll live longer.
